meanings.sent1: The seashell had a whelky appearance.
meanings.sent2: Her skin felt whelky after spending the day at the beach.
meanings.sent3: The bumpy road was so whelky that it felt like walking on seashells.
meanings.sent4: The old tree bark was whelky, like a shell from the ocean.
meanings.sent5: The rough texture of the fabric was whelky, making it uncomfortable to touch.

meanings.definition: Having a rough, bumpy texture like a whelk.
meanings.sent1: The carpet was so whelky that it hurt my feet to walk on it.
meanings.sent2: The rock had a whelky surface that made it difficult to climb.
meanings.sent3: The whelky feeling of the sandpaper made it perfect for smoothing out rough edges.
meanings.sent4: Her voice had a whelky quality, rough and uneven like a seashell.
meanings.sent5: The whelky texture of the fruit's skin made it unappealing to touch.

meanings.definition: A type of marine snail with a spiral shell.
meanings.sent1: The whelky crawled slowly along the ocean floor.
meanings.sent2: She collected a variety of whelkies during her beachcombing adventure.
meanings.sent3: The chef prepared a delicious pasta dish with fresh whelkies.
meanings.sent4: The whelky's shell was a beautiful spiral, like a miniature work of art.
meanings.sent5: Children love to pick up whelkies and listen to the sound of the ocean inside.
